Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2012 07:09AM MissC wrote: Thanks guys! The guidelines reference is a godsent. If I had never logged into this forum I would of never known..thanks! Trying to get in touch with my oncologist is like trying to reach the president. I need to discuss exactly the critera noted for the lack of radiotherapy offered. I feel like a dog with a bone now and have reached out to the nurse who has finally gotten back to me  only to say the DR said radiation was not necessary - AARRGGHH! Why? At least now I have plenty of information to present / query when I finally can meet this oncologist. Like everyone here, I just want to cover ALL bases....not doing this again.
Posts.Title: Oncology consult and chemotherapy Waitingforthenextstep maa764

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2012 05:14PM - edited Sep 9, 2012 05:18PM by MissC Hi again. Feel as though I am obsessed with opting to seek out radiation. I beleive from a scientific / medical perspective it may not be deemed as warrented. However, as a single mom with 3 kids and every need to be here for them I do believe this justifies a need to - at least - discuss the benefit of the radiation. I have yet to be conservative in my approach to this 'thing' growing in me and I dont think now is the time to concede to convention.. From what I have read, radiation post BMX can in fact improve chances of no reoccurance by as much as 23% so ..enough said. There is still a chance that residual cells remain on the chest wall post surgery so this is enough reason for me to schedual an appointment and hash this out........ Thanks all - the insight and leads to material online has been priceless.
Posts.Title: Oncology consult and chemotherapy Waitingforthenextstep maa764

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2012 04:30PM MissC wrote: Can someone please offer some insight? I am a 47 year old woman diagnosed with  the following. I have just begun my TC ( 4 cycles) last week. I will follow this with hormone therapy for 5 years..I am very concened at the lack of radiation therapy. Is this reasonable or should I enquire as to why I am NOT receiving rads? I just want to be as proactive as I possibly can and I am not sure if rads should be considered?? Ductal Carcinoma - Stage 2B Estrogen + / Progestran + HER2 negative DCIS + I had a bilateral mastectomy ;ast month and 20 nodes removed and 1 node was positve. Please please help me understand :)
Posts.Title: Oncology consult and chemotherapy Waitingforthenextstep maa764

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2012 03:32PM MissC wrote: That is some fantastic insight. Given my fairly new introduction into the new realm I am continuing to educate myself so feel moderately ignorant here ..so this is fantastic. My tumor was 2 cm / 1 mode involved out of 20..The DR did say exactly as you stated; if in fact 3 more came back positive then radiation would be offered. What is uneasy for me is that I know no more than this in terms of all you have presented here..i do not know if there was angiolymphatic invasion or what the margins were as I never got to scan the pathology report. I am an American living in Ireland and the process is frustrating. You dont get to see the report, you have to apply to get copies (which I have) and there is no referrel to the Radiologist since the DR didnt think it was warrented! I feel like pulling my hair out!!  How are you feeling - mentally / emotionally these days? Are you OK?
Posts.Title: Oncology consult and chemotherapy Waitingforthenextstep maa764

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2012 07:04AM MissC wrote: Hi ladies - I am posting this in reply to my own post on Sept 2012 regarding need for rads..I met with my oncologist yesterday and my radiologist that I have been referred to..I am taking part in the following clinical trial regarding this VERY issue. Please take the time to read it as it has confirmed my belief that perhaps, yes, rads are effective and warrented post a BMX - happy reading...and watch this space. http://www.supremo-trial.com/index.asp
